intro: Umbilicus gaditanus, commonly known as the Spanish umbilical plant, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its umbrella-like inflorescence, known as a umbel, which consists of numerous small white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
